metadata.Title: CVE-2023-27522 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: HTTP Response Smuggling vulnerability in Apache HTTP Server via mod_proxy_uwsgi. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server: from 2.4.30 through 2.4.55. Special characters in the origin response header can truncate/split the response forwarded to the client.

criterions.comment: apache2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
